title: What is the best way to create a video conference application? What are the best tools and technology to be used? - Quora

response.answer_text: Personally, I’d go with WebRTC and HTML5 and just do the client side in a modern browser, offloading the camera and audio control on someone else. So the client-side application becomes a web page.You still need a central server to do multi-point, probably with transcoding and bandwidth matching (A,B and C talking but C is on a slow line and can’t keep up, so you downconvert their video feed rather than dropping packets). Also since most home users are on NAT, you can’t just connect endpoints together directly. You really need a server in each region that you service, you can’t just have everyone on the planet connect via Cuba because the latency will be annoying. So you need a lot of cloud services in different countries, which at least is easier than opening your own data centres.
